Docs.summary: A mock class.

remarks.para: A mock class. All methods are non-functional and throw . Override it to provide the operations that you need.

.method public hidebysig virtual instance void AddPackageToPreferred(string packageName) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool AddPermission (Android.Content.PM.PermissionInfo info);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool AddPermission(class Android.Content.PM.PermissionInfo info) cil managed

Docs.param: Description of the permission to be added.
Docs.summary: Add a new dynamic permission to the system.

remarks.para: Add a new dynamic permission to the system. For this to work, your package must have defined a permission tree through the tag in its manifest. A package can only add permissions to trees that were defined by either its own package or another with the same user id; a permission is in a tree if it matches the name of the permission tree + ".": for example, "com.foo.bar" is a member of the permission tree "com.foo".

It is good to make your permission tree name descriptive, because you are taking possession of that entire set of permission names. Thus, it must be under a domain you control, with a suffix that will not match any normal permissions that may be declared in any applications that are part of that domain.

New permissions must be added before any .apks are installed that use those permissions. Permissions you add through this method are remembered across reboots of the device. If the given permission already exists, the info you supply here will be used to update it.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool AddPermissionAsync (Android.Content.PM.PermissionInfo info);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool AddPermissionAsync(class Android.Content.PM.PermissionInfo info) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.
Docs.summary: Like but asynchronously persists the package manager state after returning from the call, allowing it to return quicker and batch a series of adds at the expense of no guarantee the added permission will be retained if the device is rebooted before it is written.

remarks.para: Like but asynchronously persists the package manager state after returning from the call, allowing it to return quicker and batch a series of adds at the expense of no guarantee the added permission will be retained if the device is rebooted before it is written.

MemberSignature.Value: public override Android.Content.PM.SignatureResult CheckSignatures (int uid1, int uid2);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance valuetype Android.Content.PM.SignatureResult CheckSignatures(int32 uid1, int32 uid2) cil managed

Docs.param: First UID whose signature will be compared.
Second UID whose signature will be compared.
Docs.summary: Compare the signatures of two packages to determine if the same signature appears in both of them.

remarks.para: Like , but takes UIDs of the two packages to be checked. This can be useful, for example, when doing the check in an IPC, where the UID is the only identity available. It is functionally identical to determining the package associated with the UIDs and checking their signatures.

MemberSignature.Value: public override Android.Content.PM.SignatureResult CheckSignatures (string pkg1, string pkg2);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance valuetype Android.Content.PM.SignatureResult CheckSignatures(string pkg1, string pkg2) cil managed

Docs.param: First package name whose signature will be compared.
Second package name whose signature will be compared.
Docs.summary: Compare the signatures of two packages to determine if the same signature appears in both of them.

remarks.para: Compare the signatures of two packages to determine if the same signature appears in both of them. If they do contain the same signature, then they are allowed special privileges when working with each other: they can share the same user-id, run instrumentation against each other, etc.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void ExtendVerificationTimeout (int id, Android.Content.PM.PackageInstallVerification verificationCodeAtTimeout, long millisecondsToDelay);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance void ExtendVerificationTimeout(int32 id, valuetype Android.Content.PM.PackageInstallVerification verificationCodeAtTimeout, int64 millisecondsToDelay) cil managed

Docs.param: pending package identifier as passed via the Intent extra.
either or . If verificationCodeAtTimeout is neither or , then verificationCodeAtTimeout will default to .
the amount of time requested for the timeout. Must be positive and less than . If millisecondsToDelay is out of bounds, millisecondsToDelay will be set to the closest in bounds value; namely, 0 or .
Docs.summary: Allows a package listening to the to extend the default timeout for a response and declare what action to perform after the timeout occurs.

remarks.para:
Allows a package listening to the to extend the default timeout for a response and declare what action to perform after the timeout occurs. The response must include the verificationCodeAtTimeout which is one of or .
This method may only be called once per package id. Additional calls will have no effect.

MemberSignature.Value: public override Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable GetActivityBanner (Android.Content.ComponentName activityName);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable GetActivityBanner(class Android.Content.ComponentName activityName) cil managed

Docs.param: Name of the activity whose banner is to be retrieved.
Docs.summary: Retrieve the banner associated with an Intent.

remarks.para: Retrieve the banner associated with an activity. Given the full name of an activity, retrieves the information about it and calls to return its banner. If the activity cannot be found, NameNotFoundException is thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: public override Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable GetActivityBanner (Android.Content.Intent intent);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable GetActivityBanner(class Android.Content.Intent intent) cil managed

Docs.param: The intent for which you would like to retrieve a banner.
Docs.summary: Retrieve the banner associated with an Intent.

remarks.para: Retrieve the banner associated with an Intent. If intent.getClassName() is set, this simply returns the result of getActivityBanner(intent.getClassName()). Otherwise it resolves the intent's component and returns the banner associated with the resolved component. If intent.getClassName() cannot be found or the Intent cannot be resolved to a component, NameNotFoundException is thrown.

Docs.param: The name of the package to inspect.
Docs.summary: Returns a "good" intent to launch a front-door activity in a package.

remarks.para: Returns a "good" intent to launch a front-door activity in a package. This is used, for example, to implement an "open" button when browsing through packages. The current implementation looks first for a main activity in the category , and next for a main activity in the category . Returns null if neither are found.

The current implementation will look for a main activity in the category , or return null if no main leanback activities are found.
Throws if a package with the given name cannot be found on the system.

remarks.para: Retrieve the official name associated with a user id. This name is guaranteed to never change, though it is possibly for the underlying user id to be changed. That is, if you are storing information about user ids in persistent storage, you should use the string returned by this function instead of the raw user-id.

MemberSignature.Value: public override Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable GetUserBadgedDrawableForDensity (Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable drawable, Android.OS.UserHandle user, Android.Graphics.Rect badgeLocation, int badgeDensity);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable GetUserBadgedDrawableForDensity(class Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable drawable, class Android.OS.UserHandle user, class Android.Graphics.Rect badgeLocation, int32 badgeDensity) cil managed

Docs.param: The drawable to badge.
The target user.
Where in the bounds of the badged drawable to place the badge. If not provided, the badge is applied on top of the entire drawable being badged.
The optional desired density for the badge as per . If not provided, the density of the display is used.
Docs.summary: If the target user is a managed profile of the calling user or the caller is itself a managed profile, then this returns a badged copy of the given drawable allowing the user to distinguish it from the original drawable.

remarks.para: If the target user is a managed profile of the calling user or the caller is itself a managed profile, then this returns a badged copy of the given drawable allowing the user to distinguish it from the original drawable. The caller can specify the location in the bounds of the drawable to be badged where the badge should be applied as well as the density of the badge to be used.
If the original drawable is a BitmapDrawable and the backing bitmap is mutable as per , the bading is performed in place and the original drawable is returned.

Docs.param: The icon to badge.
The target user.
Docs.summary: If the target user is a managed profile of the calling user or the caller is itself a managed profile, then this returns a badged copy of the given icon to be able to distinguish it from the original icon.

remarks.para: If the target user is a managed profile of the calling user or the caller is itself a managed profile, then this returns a badged copy of the given icon to be able to distinguish it from the original icon. For badging an arbitrary drawable use .
If the original drawable is a BitmapDrawable and the backing bitmap is mutable as per , the badging is performed in place and the original drawable is returned.

This is like , except it also allows you to supply a list of more explicit Intents that you would like to resolve to particular options, and takes care of returning the final ResolveInfo list in a reasonable order, with no duplicates, based on those inputs.

Additional option flags. The most important is , to limit the resolution to only those activities that support the .

remarks.para: Determine the best action to perform for a given Intent. This is how finds an activity if a class has not been explicitly specified.

Note: if using an implicit Intent (without an explicit ComponentName specified), be sure to consider whether to set the only flag. You need to do so to resolve the activity in the same way that and do.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void SetApplicationEnabledSetting (string packageName, Android.Content.PM.ComponentEnabledState newState, Android.Content.PM.ComponentEnableOption flags);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance void SetApplicationEnabledSetting(string packageName, valuetype Android.Content.PM.ComponentEnabledState newState, valuetype Android.Content.PM.ComponentEnableOption flags) cil managed

Docs.param: The package name of the application to enable

The new enabled state for the component. The legal values for this state are: ,
and
The last one removes the setting, thereby restoring the applications's state to whatever was set in its manifest (or enabled, by default).
Optional behavior flags: or 0.
Docs.summary: Set the enabled setting for an application This setting will override any enabled state which may have been set by the application in its manifest.

remarks.para: Set the enabled setting for an application This setting will override any enabled state which may have been set by the application in its manifest. It also overrides the enabled state set in the manifest for any of the application's components. It does not override any enabled state set by for any of the application's components.

Docs.param: The component to enable

The new enabled state for the component. The legal values for this state are: ,
and
The last one removes the setting, thereby restoring the component's state to whatever was set in it's manifest (or enabled, by default).
Optional behavior flags: or 0.
Docs.summary: Set the enabled setting for a package component (activity, receiver, service, provider).

remarks.para: Set the enabled setting for a package component (activity, receiver, service, provider). This setting will override any enabled state which may have been set by the component in its manifest.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void SetInstallerPackageName (string targetPackage, string installerPackageName);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void SetInstallerPackageName(string targetPackage, string installerPackageName) cil managed

Docs.param: The installed package whose installer will be changed.
The package name of the new installer. May be null to clear the association.
Docs.summary: Change the installer associated with a given package.

remarks.para:
Change the installer associated with a given package. There are limitations on how the installer package can be changed; in particular:
A SecurityException will be thrown if installerPackageName is not signed with the same certificate as the calling application.
A SecurityException will be thrown if targetPackage already has an installer package, and that installer package is not signed with the same certificate as the calling application.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override IntPtr ThresholdClass { get; }
.property instance native int ThresholdClass

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
